item.title: Ongoing MicroSD Shortages Could Have A Knock-On Effect For Switch 2 Storage Availability
item.content:encoded:
Storage-hungry consumers in Japan have been jumping on available stocks of super-fast MicroSD cards as an ongoing memory shortage continues across the computer industry, with no signs of getting better in the immediate future.

As reported by Tom's Hardware, a spiralling issue of rising costs and demand that's far exceeding availability means empty shelves and insane prices as regular consumers swoop on anything that's left over once large data centres and AI companies have bought up their fill. Oh, AI, is there anything you can't make worse?

Speaking with IT Media, Tokyo-based vendor Techhouse Toei said that its inventory had been very badly affected. "The larger versions of popular series keep running out of stock...This might drag on for a while." With all sizes of MicroSD cards, from 256GB all the way up to 2TB models involved, it's not hard to see how or why consumers (and those pesky AI centres) might start to make the jump en masse to new and improved MicroSD Express technology used in Switch 2.

The report goes on to detail how even older tech, such as HDD drives with huge storage capacities, is being bought up. "It looks like large-capacity models are getting sucked up for AI use," one shop owner said, "so we aren't getting any stock at all. Everyone knows what's going on, so even if the price goes up, the drives sell out immediately… and the cycle repeats."

It's certainly something that's already been an issue here in the West, and even through our own personal searching for MicroSD Express cards online, it's been notably hard to find sizes beyond 256GB for anything approaching a reasonable price, and the 1TB options are already being sold for...well, a quick search indicates around £200, which is quite a lot.

Some of this, of course, has been down to the popularity of Nintendo's console, but there's little doubt that any further stress on MicroSD availability would make it significantly harder to find a card for your Switch 2.

With no signs of the supply situation abating, and with AI being the number one reason cited behind all of the shortages of storage, RAM, and GPUs, it does seem as though the prepared Switch 2 gamer should perhaps brace for the inevitable impact and nab some backup storage ASAP.

Have you already bought a MicroSD card to satisfy your needs for your Switch 2? Had trouble buying one, or found them too expensive? Make sure to let us know.

[source itmedia.co.jp, via tomshardware.com]



https://www.nintendolife.com/news/2025/11/ongoing-microsd-shortages-could-have-a-knock-on-effect-for-switch-2-storage-availability

item.title: Nintendo Switch First-Party Games Like Super Mario Odyssey Get Rare Discount For Black Friday 2025
item.content:encoded:
Nintendo first-party developed games rarely get discounts, but the Japanese publisher decided to briefly amend their pricing strategy just in time for Black Friday 2025, offering some of its best Nintendo Switch games at reduced prices.

Among the Switch games that can be purchased for reduced prices this week is Super Mario Odyssey, available for $39.99 (50% off the MSRP). The game is also fully playable on Nintendo Switch 2, so if you never played the game before and own any of the Switch systems, there's no better time to get it, and experience what is widely considered one of the best 3D Mario games ever.

Other notable Nintendo Switch Black Friday 2025 deals include Splatoon 3, Princess Peach: Showtime, Donkey Kong Country Returns HD, The Legend of Zelda: Echoes of Wisdom, and many others. You can check out all the deals available this week by heading over to Amazon.

Should You Go For These Nintendo Switch Black Friday 2025 Deals Now or Wait?

As Black Friday 2025 is still a few days away, some additional deals are expected to become available as we get closer to November 28.

However, given Nintendo's historical stance on pricing and their previous Black Friday deals, it is doubtful you will be able to find better discounts than these in the next couple of days. Nintendo’s first-party titles are known to maintain their value for years. As such, you should definitely take advantage of these deals as soon as possible before stock runs out.

Looking for accessories or other games on sale? Check out our comprehensive Nintendo Switch 2 (and original Switch) list of the best Black Friday 2025 deals available this week.

item.title: Valve confirm the Steam Machine will be priced like a PC with similar specs, rather than a console
item.content:encoded:
Still no concrete money number, though

Right, time for some box news. The Steam Machine. Valve have confirmed, or reaffirmed, that its yet-to-be-revealed price will be in line with a regular PC built to similar specs, rather than subsidised in order to try and compete with consoles.

Speaking on Skill Up's Friends Per Second podcast, Valve’s Pierre-Loup Griffais said the device's price still hasn't been settled on internally due to some factors which are "fluctuating", but said the aim's to offer a "good deal" compared to a the sorts of existing PCs which offer comparable bang for your buck.

He went on to confirm that the price won't be subsidised by Valve in an effort to keep it on the lower end and compete with consoles, an idea that's been floated around on the lines since the box's reveal. To be honest, as someone who can't currently see where the Steam Machine would fit into my existing setup of a decently beefy desktop and a PS5, that'd be something in its favour, but I'm also conscious that I may well just not be the target audience for the thing. Then again, I'm also yet to invest in a Steam Deck despite regularly being told I likely won't regret it, so maybe I just don't like spending money.

"It’s more in line with what you might expect from the current PC market," Griffais said of the Machine. "Obviously, our goal is for it to be a good deal at that level of performance. And then you have features that are actually really hard to build if you’re making your own gaming PC from parts." Those features are the likes of its small size, quietness, and ability to be easily flicked on via TV remote or controller.

Basically, a level of ease or convenience which he reckons is "not really something that exists in the PC market right now". That sounds very much like an 'appeal to newbies considering making the switch' pitch to me, but could also have some catchet with folks who're just keen not to muck around with a/their big PC for everything but the most hairdryer-inducing behemoths (hi, Red Dead Redemption 2).

For now, we'll just have to see what number Valve finally settle on and judge things from that. Until that point, there are far more important conversations to be had, as James dipped his toe into last week when he tried to define whether the Steam Machine has soul. Can PC hardware be Aretha Frankliny? Probably, I guess.



https://www.rockpapershotgun.com/valve-confirm-the-steam-machine-will-be-priced-like-a-pc-with-similar-specs-rather-than-a-console

item.title: Samsung Offloads Galaxy Tab A9+ for Pocket Change, Better Than Budget Tablets Yet Priced Below Them
item.content:encoded:
Samsung launches new flagship tablets every year and the latest models, like the Tab S11 series, easily cost upwards of $1,000. The 2024 Galaxy Tab A9+ finds its place in the middle of budget and premium and offers solid specs without the price of a flagship. You get an 11-inch tablet ready to provide a quality Android experience for consumption, casual gaming and productivity tasks. Now down to just $149 from $219 for the 64GB/WiFi, it has reached a record-low price on Amazon for Black Friday.

See at Amazon

Big Screen Entertainment

It has an 11-inch display running at a resolution of 1920 x 1200, and provides sharp text and detailed video playback. The 90Hz refresh rate gives you a noticeably smoother scrolling through apps and websites compared to the more common 60Hz on tablets. Peak brightness reaches 480 nits to give you good visibility outdoors or in bright rooms. The TFT LCD panel does a solid job with color reproduction-whether you’re watching shows, browsing photos, or reading e-books.

Dolby Atmos powered quad speakers turn this tablet into a surprisingly capable media machine. Movies, TV shows, and music will all be augmented by the increased audio that fills a room. The speakers feature directional sound, a more immersive experience than that of single or dual speaker arrangements. You can comfortably watch content without having to use headphones and actually hear what is being said.

The Qualcomm Snapdragon 69 processor performs everyday tasks with competent performance. Streaming video, web browsing, social media scrolling, and casual gaming are relatively smooth. Similarly, 4GB of RAM manages multiple apps open simultaneously without excessive slowdown. You won’t mistake this for a flagship tablet when running demanding games or heavy multitasking, but it covers the basics reliably. The 64GB of internal storage expands up to 1TB via microSD card and gives you room for downloaded content and files.

Multi Window Display lets you run multiple apps side by side on the large screen: Browse the web while checking email, take notes while doing video calls, or refer to a document while writing in another app. This split-screen functionality turns the tablet into a productivity tool for real work: students can research and write papers in parallel, professionals can manage spreadsheets while being part of video conferences.

Quick Share makes it easy to transfer files across devices: Send photos, videos, or documents to other nearby Samsung devices, Android phones, or even iPhones. Choose the file you want to share, select the device nearby, and voilà! In a few seconds, your file transfers wirelessly. No more need for pesky email attachments or cloud uploads for simple file sharing. Immediately swap vacation photos with family members.

This Black Friday, the Samsung Galaxy Tab A9+ is $149 which means it offers solid tablet performance at an accessible price. You’re getting an 11-inch 90Hz display, quad speakers with Dolby Atmos, expandable storage up to 1TB, multi-window multitasking, and Samsung Kids parental controls for 32% off retail.

See at Amazon



https://kotaku.com/samsung-offloads-galaxy-tab-a9-for-pocket-change-better-than-budget-tablets-yet-priced-below-them-2000646799

item.title: Hytale Reveals Plans For Proximity Chat & Multiplayer ‘Portals’
item.content:encoded:
Hytale devs are working on two significant social features to add to the game, with proximity chat and the potential of ‘portals’ in single-player that allow friends to join your game without having to tweak settings.

News on Hytale continues to come thick and fast following the founders reacquiring the title from Riot Games, with pricing revealed last week and details on the early access release date arriving in the coming days.

The early access launch will be a major step for the future of Hytale, but there is still a lot to come, and two major features have been revealed.

Proximity Chat & Multiplayer Support in Single-Player Coming to Hytale

In an in-depth interview with YouTuber ElRichMC, Hypixel Studios founder Simon Collins-Laflamme answered a range of questions about the development of Hytale and plans for the future, alongside taking the opportunity to reveal two components that are in the works.

One of those is support for multiplayer in single-player worlds, allowing players to have drop-in, drop-out gameplay with friends, but, in a bid to make it more immersive, the current plan is for an item that needs to be built to access the feature.

“I want the game to be more social, so I was thinking, what if, to invite your friends, you have to make a portal? And when you leave the game, they go out from that portal, to make it more immersive,” Collins-Laflamme said.

While this may seem like a simple feature, it’s added that “some other popular games don’t have it,” and the crucial aspect is the ability to “invite your friend with no need to change your firewall settings.”

Another feature that goes hand-in-hand with the planned multiplayer functionality is proximity chat, which is confirmed to be in the works, but Collins-Laflamme admitted he’s “not sure” whether the feature will be available at the early access launch.

Voice chat is “very important” for Hytale, opening the doors for plenty of other experiences to be built, particularly given the expansive modding support the game will have.

What are you most excited to see in Hytale? Share your thoughts with other players in the Insider Gaming Discord.

For more news, take a look at the latest ARC Raiders sales data, and check out the big collabs that could be arriving as Fortnite Sidekicks.

item.title: Fortnite to Add Animated Favorites as Sidekicks, Leaks Claim
item.content:encoded:
Fortnite’s Sidekicks feature looks set to receive a huge flock of collabs, according to leakers, as a major agreement with Paramount is said to have been reached.

The Sidekicks feature was added earlier this month, featuring customizable pets, visible only to you and players in your party, in specific modes, and additional Sidekicks are expected to be added regularly.

A first collab Sidekick has been added in The Simpsons season, with Scratchy coming in the Itchy & Scratchy bundle, and other animated stars are on the horizon.

Paramount IPs Coming to Fortnite as Sidekicks

According to reliable Fortnite leakers, including SamLeakss, Paramount IPs are coming to Fortnite as Sidekicks, which aligns with previous leaks indicating collabs with the likes of SpongeBob Squarepants.

No specifics have been shared on what collabs to expect, but there is a lengthy list of potentials, with Paramount’s expansive list of IPs including the likes of SpongeBob, Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles, Transformers, and more.

Some of those franchises, including TMNT and Transformers, have already featured as collabs in the past, including with skins, but the new Sidekick feature opens the door for other characters, smaller in size, to feature.

One of the biggest franchises under the Paramount umbrella that would certainly fit the Sidekicks theme is Paw Patrol, though the show is geared to a younger audience and may therefore not be suited to featuring in Fortnite.

An agreement with Paramount opens the door for plenty of options, and time will tell exactly what will be added to the game, but it’s clear Epic Games has big fans to utilize Sidekicks in more collabs.

Which Paramount IP do you want to see featured in Fortnite? Share your thoughts with other players in the Insider Gaming Discord.

For more Fortnite, check out the reveal of the Back to the Future collab in Chapter 7, and take a look at exactly when the end of chapter live event takes place.

item.title: SIVGA Robin SV021 Wired Headphones Review
item.content:encoded:
I’ve been fascinated with headphones from an early age. My dad was a broadcast journalist and a real geek, filling our house with space-age tech like reel-to-reel players, condenser microphones, and CB radios. Most important, though, were the headphones. Huge, unwieldy things for my tiny head, they still opened my eyes – and ears – to just how good music could sound, and that fascination has stayed with me ever since.

So my interest was piqued by SIVGA’s latest, the Robin SV021, a closed-back, wired audiophile pair of over-ear headphones, which boast earcups crafted from wood. While they look genuinely beautiful, the sound they produce is even better.

Each of the Robin SV021’s earcups are handmade from Rosewood. If you want a pair of headphones that’s immediately different from the metal and black plastic-toting ones elsewhere, it’s a great place to start. Imprinted with the SIVGA logo, the external surface is perfectly smooth, and the wood carries a warmth and softness that plastic and metal simply can’t. I did worry about their durability, but after cramming the Robin into my bag on more than one occasion, they remained unblemished.

Elsewhere, the headband is wrapped in leather, with a thin slice of memory foam beneath it, while the frame, extenders and hinges are made from rigid, burnished metal. It’s all finished off by a pair of the plushest, softest ear cushions I’ve come across in a while, and they feel absolutely fantastic, moulding around your ears and providing a decent level of passive noise cancellation as well. The Robin SV021 look and feel utterly premium, and they definitely punch above their £150 price point.

Audio is handled by dual wiring to each earcup, with the two ends of the braided cable leading down to a single gold-plated 3.5mm jack. While the braided section is noise-free, the single cabling to each earcup will produce cable noise if rubbing against clothing, which does make it less appealing for listening while on the go.

That’s not its main draw, though. The Robin SV021 are reassuringly universal, and I’ve spent my time hopping between a MacBook, Nintendo Switch 2 and my PC. It has a relatively low impedance at 32 Ohms, and it performed well with every device I tried, with plenty of volume while retaining an excellent level of detail.

The SIVGA Robin SV021 sound excellent. The 50mm drivers are capable of moving plenty of air around, and there’s a wonderfully wide soundstage here, giving instrumentation and audio some real room to breathe. I’ve been playing a huge amount of Octopath Traveler 0 on its way to review, and the orchestral soundtrack has been delivered exquisitely by the Robin SV021, with that wider soundstage making it feel as though you’re experiencing a live recording.

They’re absolutely perfect for gaming, thanks to their lightweight design and ultra-soft ear cushions. I was able to wear them for hours, and they may well be the most comfortable headphones I’ve reviewed this year.

Checking in with my music collection, I loved how enveloping Gunship’s Tech Noir sounded, with the throbbing synth tones delivered with an exacting level of detail. The intro’s sci-fi spoken word sits clearly apart from the ominous notes beneath, while the bass response is excellent, with plenty of warmth and clarity. The Robin SV021 are certainly warmer-sounding rather than clinical, and they’re easy to live with across a range of different genres and content types. Crucially, they make you want to listen to music.

At £150, the Robin SV021 are aimed at the mid-range audiophile who’s looking for something a little different. Despite their closed-back design, they boast a wide soundstage, and their well-balanced tuning provides a hugely enjoyable listening experience no matter what you’re using them for.



https://www.thesixthaxis.com/2025/11/24/sivga-robin-sv021-wired-headphones-review/

item.title: FromSoftware Spent More Time On The Duskbloods’ Gameplay Than Any Other Title, Including Elden Ring, Leak Claims
item.content:encoded:
• 0-20%: Unlikely - Lacks credible sources
  • 21-40%: Questionable - Some concerns remain
  • 41-60%: Plausible - Reasonable evidence
  • 61-80%: Probable - Strong evidence
  • 81-100%: Highly Likely - Multiple reliable sources

As FromSoftware continues working on Elden Ring Nightreign, the Japanese development studio is also hard at work on The Duskbloods, which reportedly is a game the developer has spent time on fine tuning gameplay the most.

As reported in a new video shared by Ziostorm, a Chinese journalist who provided accurate information on Elden Ring before the game's release, recently revealed some small, exciting tidbits about FromSoftware's upcoming Nintendo Switch 2 exclusive. The game was reportedly greenlit even before the marketing campaign for Sekiro: Shadows Die Twice started, and it is the game that FromSoftware has spent the most time on gameplay among all of their games.

All the time spent on prototyping The Duskbloods' gameplay is reportedly paying off, as the game, although PvEvP, features many innovative gameplay elements that the team is really proud of. So much so that the journalist speculates the game could influence games from other studios as much as the aforementioned Sekiro: Shadows Die Twice did, especially with the parry mechanics that are now prevalent in almost every action game.

Besides providing this small bit of information on The Duskbloods, the known Chinese journalist also revealed that we should see more of the Elden Ring Nightreign DLC, The Forsaken Hollow, soon. Apparently, three more trailers should be released before the game launches on December 4 to showcase the two new Nightfarers - the Scholar and the Undertaker - and the new content in a final launch trailer. As the expansion is nearing release, these trailers, if they are indeed coming, shouldn't be more than a few days away.

When it was revealed during the first Nintendo Switch 2 Nintendo Direct ever earlier this year, many, including myself, jumped at the screen at the first footage of The Duskbloods, as the game looked like a sequel to the beloved Bloodborne. However, the Switch 2 exclusive is going to be a much different game, having been built from the ground up as a multiplayer experience, which left a few disappointed, as FromSoftware is primarily known for its single-player experiences with multiplayer elements sprinkled on top.

Hopefully, the game's supposed innovative gameplay elements will make it a compelling experience for all fans of the studio, possibly turning doubters' opinions around as much as Elden Ring Nightreign did for me when it launched earlier this year on PC and consoles.

Follow Wccftech on Google to get more of our news coverage in your feeds.

item.title: The Crew Unlimited devs have prevented the Ubisoft racer's "3rd imminent death", this time via a "Y29K" bug
item.content:encoded:
A pesky date-related bug is the latest spike strip dodged

Ubisoft racer The Crew has avoided yet another shutdown after being ressurected in server-emulated form by fans earlier this year. According to the modders behind its revival project, The Crew Unlimited, a bug would have seen the game stop working once 2029 rolled around. Thankfully, they say a solution's been found.

"This may be one of the most important updates we've ever released, or arguably THE most important," reads a post from lead developer Whammy4 about The Crew Unlimited's latest server emulator update, 1.3.0.0. They outlined that not long after the server emulator's 1.0 release, the group realised that if the date on the PC it's being played on is set to something after June 2029, the game simply stops working.

"As you may imagine, we were extremely concerned (how many deaths is this game going to go through? TWO weren't enough already?)," Whammy4 explained. "At first we were hoping that it was just a bug on the TCU Server's end, but that turned out to not be the case. It is an issue within the actual game client itself, and is not intentional but rather a bug. From our research, we've narrowed it down to either the Summit calendar system (from the Wild Run 2015 update), or the daily Crate mission system (from the Calling All Units 2016 update). Likely culprit is the Summit, even though nothing in the summit calendar data references anything about a June 2029 or 2029 in general."

The good news is that the team say they've found "a less than ideal, but working fix" for this potentially lethal bug, which they've dubbed "Y29K", by making some changes to the server emulator's software. So, crisis averted, even if it sounds like more work may be needed to try and find a better solution for the long-term.

Here's hoping The Crew can manage to go a few years without any more existential threats from this point, even if its initial shutdown's had the silver lining of sparking worthwhile debate about what the end of service for online-only games should look like going forwards.



https://www.rockpapershotgun.com/the-crew-unlimited-devs-have-prevented-the-ubisoft-racers-3rd-imminent-death-this-time-via-a-y29k-bug

item.title: Udo Kier, the German Actor Who Played Yuri in Command and Conquer: Red Alert and Was Set to Star in OD, Dies Aged 81 — Hideo Kojima Says 'There Will N
item.content:encoded:
"I’m at a loss for words."

Udo Kier, the German actor who starred in over 200 films, has died aged 81.

Kier, who appeared in 275 roles including in My Own Private Idaho, Blade, Armageddon, and Dogville, as well as Madonna music videos and video games, died on Sunday morning, his partner Delbert McBride confirmed to Variety. Photographer Michael Childers took to social media to say Kier died in hospital in Palm Springs, California. A cause of death has not yet been revealed.

The horror film specialist had a breakout role in 1970’s Mark of the Devil, before being cast as Frankenstein in 1973’s Flesh for Frankenstein, then Dracula in 1974’s Blood for Dracula — both produced by artist Andy Warhol. His first American role came in 1991 film My Own Private Idaho, which starred River Phoenix and Keanu Reeves. Madonna, a fan of Kier's work, cast him in her music videos for Erotica and Deeper and Deeper. Later notable roles came in the likes of Ace Ventura: Pet Detective, Johnny Mnemonic, Armageddon, End of Days, and Blade. Kier’s final film was the political thriller The Secret Agent, in which he played a Jewish Holocaust survivor caught in the final years of the Brazilian military dictatorship.

As well as starring in hundreds of films, Kier was no stranger to the world of video games. He famously played Yuri in the live-action cutscenes that formed a part of Command & Conquer: Red Alert 2’s story, and reprised the role in 2001’s Command & Conquer: Yuri's Revenge.

RIP Udo Kier, who passed away today at the age of 81.

His performance as Yuri in Red Alert 2 has always stuck with me, and it’s one I constantly reference. I’m sad we won’t get to see you in Kojima’s OD but thank you for the great memories. pic.twitter.com/d8Y2ZBmV5r

— Bucky | Palworld (@Bucky_cm) November 24, 2025

Later, he had voice roles in 2017’s Call of Duty: WWII, and 2022’s Martha is Dead. He was set to appear in OD, the upcoming horror video game by Hideo Kojima and producer Jordan Peele, and indeed was a part of its teaser trailer, below, showing initial face scan work. It is unclear whether Kier will now be recast in the upcoming Microsoft game.

Kojima took to social media to pay tribute to Kier, expressing his shock at the news.

“I’m at a loss for words,” Kojima said. “It all happened far too suddenly. Because of the strike, we weren’t able to shoot OD for a long time, and we were forced to reschedule to next year. Even during that time, Udo and I exchanged emails frequently. We stayed in close contact. When we met in Milan at the end of September, he told me how much he was looking forward to the shoot starting up again next year. He was full of energy then too, making me laugh with his usual ‘Udo-isms.’

“I still can’t believe this. Udo wasn’t just an actor. He was truly an ‘icon’ of his time. We’ve lost a great ‘icon.’ There will never be another like him. Udo, rest in peace. I will never forget you.”

The tweet video below, shows Kojima and Kier together in Milan in September.

With Udo Kier. pic.twitter.com/6tdXYLY8aW

— HIDEO_KOJIMA (@HIDEO_KOJIMA_EN) September 26, 2025

Wesley is Director, News at IGN. Find him on Twitter at @wyp100. You can reach Wesley at wesley_yinpoole@ign.com or confidentially at wyp100@proton.me.

item.title: Palworld is getting a new crossover with one of the coolest indie games in recent memory
item.content:encoded:
Palworld has announced a new update in December titled 'Home Sweet Home', which includes a vast amount of base customisation options as well as a crossover with one of the coolest indie games in recent memory. It's set to release just around the corner too, on the 17th December.

This game is Ultrakill, the high-intensity ultraviolent FPS by Arsi Patala, which is coming to Pocketpair's open world creature collection game. As part of the Home Sweet Home update, players will be able to venture the world as either V1 or V2, reflecting bullets off flipped coins and blasting away Pals with a new shotgun.

When not murdering animals in-game, you'll be able to change the colours of your bases through new customisation tools which should make your abode feel more homely. A variety of colours can be seen in the new trailer, all of which are quite vibrant.

Palworld and Pocketpair continue trucking along all this time after its explosive release back in 2024. As you may know, the developer has been in the midst of a legal battle with Nintendo over alleged patent infringement. This has actually been leaning in Pocketpair's favour, with a recent rejection of Nintendo's patent throwing a spanner in the works for Nintendo.

In addition, earlier this month Nintendo's patent covering the summoning of a sub character to battle an enemy was ordered to be reassessed in the USA. A rare occasion that too could spell trouble for Nintendo's lawsuit.

Palworld

PS4, PS5, Xbox One, Xbox Series X/S, PC

item.title: UK Charts: Kirby Air Riders Narrowly Misses Out On A Top Ten Spot
item.content:encoded:
The latest UK physical gaming charts are in, giving us our first indication of how Nintendo's latest is performing on store shelves. You'll have to scroll a little way to find the new first-party release this week, mind you, as Kirby Air Riders has missed out on a top 10 spot!

The game zoomed into 12th in its debut week, falling behind the likes of Mario Kart World, Pokémon Legends: Z-A, Donkey Kong Bananza, and — of course — Mario Kart 8 Deluxe, all of which keep the Switch and Switch 2 in the upper bracket.

Of course, this might not be all that much of a surprise. Air Riders was always going to attract a niche audience with its blend of racing and all-out action, and with Mario Kart World still appearing new and shiny, we'd imagine that many people will be picking up just the one racer for their fresh console. We're sure the sales will be drastically different in Japan, which we'll find out later this week

Elsewhere, Clair Obscur: Expedition 33 parried its way back into the top 10 — thanks to all of those Game Awards nominations, no doubt — and the sweet physical edition of Hades II made its debut at number 21. And if you're looking for Hyrule Warriors: Age of Imprisonment, you won't find it in this top 40...

item.title: The Fallout TV Show season 2's NCR ranger power armour has already arrived in Fallout 4 thanks to modders
item.content:encoded:
Following its cameo in the latest trailer to drop ahead of the series' December debut

Well, that was quick. Season two of Prime Video's Fallout show is still weeks away from arriving on December 17th, but a group of modders have wasted no time in studying its latest trailer and taking a crack at adding the NCR ranger power armour shown off to Fallout 4.

Can't take a break and wait for the anniversary update's fallout to totally dissipate when there's a modathon on, I guess.

Anyway, enter the Ranger Power Armour released by modder PrincessAries and co over the weekend. While not an exact replica, it's based on the armour that shows up in the most recent season two trailer (which I've embedded above) at around the two minute and ten second mark, with its wearer walking into a street wild west-style alongside The Ghoul.

The mod's armour is designed to be similar in stats to the Fallout series' iconic T-51 power armour, mirroring it being a custom set the NCR have developed, rather than the scavenged T-45d Brotherhood sets sometimes seen on NCR soldiers in New Vegas.

As with a lot of the best power armour mods, this set comes with a wide range of customisation options, including four different base paint jobs. One of those is a lick of red paint so you can sacreligiously use the armour to show how into Caesar's Legion you are. Where the mod really shines, though, is in the various accessories you can add to each bit of the armour for a different look and some stat buffs.

The likes of cloaks, backpacks, bandoliers, and helmet lenses can be mixed and matched to create a unique look. I'm a particular fan of the brahmin skulls strapped to your shoulders and enough bullet casings draped over you to be a human ammo box aesthetic, as well as the hoods which make you look like an unruly fusion-powered teenager. Though, it is worth noting that the modders admit the cloaks in particular can be subject to some clipping misbehavior, especially if you opt for a hooded one.

To get the armour, you'll need to have the Far Harbor DLC, then install the mod and head to a small shack north of the power station outside the ruined town of Natick for a short quest. Given this kind of thing's happening already, I'm keen to see what sorts of mods might arrive once season two's actually aired, assuming it gets folks going like the first one did.



https://www.rockpapershotgun.com/the-fallout-tv-show-season-2s-ncr-ranger-power-armour-has-already-arrived-in-fallout-4-thanks-to-modders

item.title: Udo Kier Dies At 81, With Kojima Honoring The Red Alert Icon And OD Actor
item.content:encoded:
GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

Legendary German actor Udo Kier has died at the age of 81. The news was confirmed by Kier's partner Delbert McBride via Variety.

With hundreds of film and TV credits spanning decades, Kier rose to fame in horror films like Mark of the Devil, Flesh for Frankenstein, and Blood for Dracula in the '70s. His breakthrough Hollywood role came in 1991's My Own Private Idaho, and he'd go on to appear in Ace Ventura: Pet Detective, Johnny Mnemonic, Armageddon, and Madonna music videos.

In recent years, Kier was one of the actors set to appear in Hideo Kojima's upcoming horror game OD. Game director Hideo Kojima wrote online that new scenes featuring the actor were scheduled to be filmed in 2026, and that he'd kept in touch with him regularly.

"I'm at a loss for words," Kojima said in a social media post. "It all happened far too suddenly. Because of the strike, we weren't able to shoot OD for a long time, and we were forced to reschedule to next year. Even during that time, Udo and I exchanged emails frequently. We stayed in close contact. When we met in Milan at the end of September, he told me how much he was looking forward to the shoot starting up again next year."

I’m at a loss for words. It all happened far too suddenly.
Because of the strike, we weren’t able to shoot “OD” for a long time, and we were forced to reschedule to next year. Even during that time, Udo and I exchanged emails frequently. We stayed in close contact. When we met in… pic.twitter.com/aRpP1i38CE

— HIDEO_KOJIMA (@HIDEO_KOJIMA_EN) November 24, 2025

Kier was well-known for playing the iconic Command & Conquer antagonist Yuri in the live-action cutscenes for Red Alert 2 and its expansion, Yuri's Revenge. He'd also lend his distinctive voice to characters in the games Call of Duty: WWII and Martha is Dead.

Got a news tip or want to contact us directly? Email news@gamespot.com

item.title: ARC Raiders Soared in Sales After Just Two Days on the Market, Data Reveals
item.content:encoded:
In a fresh report from NewZoo, it has been confirmed that ARC Raiders skyrocketed within just two days on the market, beating many of the world’s most capable and impactful games in October’s revenue charts. The data revealed that ARC Raiders secured the seventh spot in the charts in October, despite being released on October 30.

ARC Raiders has proven to be one of the most transformative games ever released, taking over the extraction shooter genre and retaining an enormous player base almost a month after release.

ARC Raiders On Top (Almost)

In an all-new October revenue report from NewZoo, it was documented that ARC Raiders hit the seventh spot in the charts despite being on the shelves for just two days in October.

It effortlessly walked over some of the biggest games in the business:

  • Counter-Strike 2
  • Call of Duty
  • Minecraft
  • VALORANT
  • ROBLOX
  • World of Warcraft
  • Marvel Rivals

The stunning achievement sat ARC Raiders behind the likes of NBA 2K26, Fortnite, Ghost of Yotei, and Battlefield 6, all of which is/were to be expected.

ARC Raiders continues to stun gamers worldwide, and everyone from diehard extraction shooter fans to those totally new to the concept is getting on board. Recently, a streamer-backed initiative saw some of the biggest creators in the space take part in an unofficial ‘war’ that pulled unprecedented audiences into some streamers’ chats.

There’s a hefty roadmap in store for ARC Raiders, and Embark Studios, the game’s stellar creator, has vowed to support the title for years to come. The next major update will be Cold Snap, coming in December 2025.

item.title: "He was truly an 'icon' of his time" - Hideo Kojima pays tribute to OD actor Udo Kier, who has passed away
item.content:encoded:
Veteran actor Udo Kier has passed away. He was 81.

Kier was born Udo Kierspe in Cologne, Germany. When he was 18, he moved to London, before going on to star in films including Ace Ventura: Pet Detective, Armageddon and Blade.

The news of his passing was shared by his partner, artist Delbert McBride. Along with his film credits, Kier also starred in a number of games, including as Yuri in the Command and Conquer: Red Alert series. The actor was also due to star in Hideo Kojima's Xbox horror game OD.

To see this content please enable targeting cookies.

Reflecting on Kier's passing, Kojima said he was "at a loss for words".

"It all happened far too suddenly," Kojima wrote on social media. "Because of the strike, we weren't able to shoot 'OD' for a long time, and we were forced to reschedule to next year. Even during that time, Udo and I exchanged emails frequently. We stayed in close contact. When we met in Milan at the end of September, he told me how much he was looking forward to the shoot starting up again next year. He was full of energy then too, making me laugh with his usual 'Udo-isms'.

"I still can't believe this.

"Udo wasn't just an actor. He was truly an 'icon' of his time. We've lost a great 'icon'. There will never be another like him.

"Udo, rest in peace. I will never forget you."

Along with Kier, Sophia Lillis, Hunter Schafer and director Jordan Peele - who is known for his films Get Out and Nope - are also connected to Kojima's OD. At the time of writing, it's unknown if Kier will be recast or if his role will be removed from the project.

Rest in peace, Udo, and thank you for all you've done.

Related topics

item.title: FEROCIOUS Is an Indie Single Player FPS Where You Fight Dinosaurs But Also Control Them, And It’s Out on December 4
item.content:encoded:
Publisher tinyBuild has announced that the indie single player first-person shooter game FEROCIOUS will be released on December 4 for PC via Steam.

FEROCIOUS, powered by Unity, is the debut game of OMYOG, a small studio that features the expertise of both AAA game and film veterans. Leonard Saalfrank, inspired by King Kong, leads the vision, while Mark, ex-Far Cry and Battlefront II director, brings sandbox-level design expertise. Writers like Jörg Ihle and Dominik Hochwald add narrative depth from film, games, and theme parks.

In FEROCIOUS, players will find themselves stranded on a dangerous island and forced to survive against mercenaries, dinosaurs, and a vibrant yet hostile ecosystem. At every turn, they must face challenges in the form of savage predators, treacherous terrain, and limited resources. Careful exploration is vital to uncover hidden paths, secrets and essential gear. Furthermore, as shown in the release date trailer (embedded below), there's a twist in that a so-called 'dino control device' lets you turn the dinosaurs to your side, so that they might be used to attack enemies, open paths, or infiltrate guarded areas.

The lore explanation is that it scans the creature's brain and reproduces its vocal signals, not unlike what was shown in Jurassic Park 3, but with the usage of ultrasonic calls that only the lizards can hear. Once scanned, the player can get a dinosaur to follow them, move to a particular spot, attack a target, break obstacles, or even fetch items. The commands depend on the species; some are more obedient (or smarter) than others. Not every dinosaur in the game will be controllable, though.

TinyBuild did not share the pricing yet, but given that it's an indie game, we expect it to be priced accordingly. The Steam page also includes the minimum and recommended PC system requirements for FEROCIOUS, by the way.

Minimum:
Requires a 64-bit processor and operating system
OS: Windows 10/11 64-bit
Processor: Intel Core i5 4th Gen or AMD equivalent
Memory: 12 GB RAM
Graphics: NVIDIA GTX 1060 / AMD RX 580
DirectX: Version 11
Storage: 25 GB available space

Recommended:
Requires a 64-bit processor and operating system
OS: Windows 10/11 64-bit
Processor: Intel Core i7 or Ryzen 5 3600 and up
Memory: 16 GB RAM
Graphics: NVIDIA RTX 2060 / AMD RX 5600
DirectX: Version 11
Storage: 25 GB available space

item.title: This week in PC games: warriors, painters, roguelikes, sailors, shotguns, subs and metroidvanias
item.content:encoded:
What we're feeding the Maw

November is... merry! As the great grim centipede of people and property that is Videogaming continues its progress of the midnight wood, a dozen auteur designers from theatre backgrounds don coxcomb hats and sequined codpieces. They climb onto carts and stage a chariot race, beating each other with bladders decorated to look like Roger Ebert. There is laughter up and down the train. Meanwhile, the industry seers and marketing-mancers have received hopeful tidings from their friends among the owls and bats. The trees are thinning out ahead. The stars can sometimes be seen. There is wild talk that third-person cover shooters are about to come back into fashion.

That isn't all the owls and bats have seen, however. As the path curves, we find ourselves in the courtyard of a squat and forbidding tower. Five levels of blood-flecked obsidian and pixelated braziers, each named for a day of the week, each infested by perfectly terrifying new PC games. Never mind that the edifice has clearly been slapped together using assets lifted from a webinar. Never mind that you can see fuchsia checkerboards everywhere. The tower's frightful denizens must be defeated - or possibly even bought - if the convoy is to proceed.

Monday 24th November

  • Nientum - Op.ZERO (early access) is a mix of 2D platforming and rhythm-action in which amnesiac anime girls restore a creepy theatre and perform twisted versions of familiar musicals.
  • On a similar theme, here's Constance, a 2D metroidvania about a somersaulting painter who is navigating worlds derived form her mental health difficulties. Your paintbrush is at least as mighty as a sword, but watch out, using its magical abilities will corrupt you.
  • Primal Fray is a turn-based, creature-collecting strategy roguelike set on floating hexagonal islands. Try to make your enemies fall off first.

Tuesday 25th November

  • In A.I.L.A you are a games tester contending with a villainous AI level designer (think Portal, not ChatGPT), rather than the more familiar problems of precarity and crunch.
  • In Newgroundsy cartoon FPS Captain Wayne - Vacation Desperation (pictured), you are a sailor with a shotgun fist on a mission "to rob the rich to feed the badass". I hear and salute the praxis of the implication that one cannot be both rich and badass.
  • In Red Rogue Sea you are playing FTL, but with pirate galleons and turn-based combat and deck-building. Not that much like FTL, perhaps.

Wednesday 26th November

  • A dragon has turned the world to night and it's your job to settle his hash in Holder Of Place, an autobattling roguelite deckbuilder.

Thursday 27th November

  • Kings Of Hell (early access) is a palpably Power-Stoned 2000s-style beat 'em up starring upwardly mobile demons.
  • Veterum is a turn-based fantasy strategy-me-do with an emphasis on shaping battlefields in your favour.

Friday 28th November

  • Death In Abyss is a 3D underwater "flight" combat game in which you play a nimble submersible with fins fighting off huge, fleshy leviathans. Chorus meets Devil Daggers, maybe?
  • Ayasa: Shadows Of Silence is a Little Nightmarish jaunt through six platforming worlds dedicated to Faith, Hope, Love, Greed, Indifference, and Betrayal. I get the sense that even the nice-sounding worlds will be dreadful.

The tower is soon afire, for in these strange and glitchy times even obsidian may burn. Our gimlet-eyed QA staff chase the surviving games into the woods; they will haunt us for months to come, stealthily adding themselves to our wishlists while we huddle in our wagons, blowing into frosty fingers and dreaming of the brighter tomorrow promised by the soothsayers. Perhaps the Second Coming is at hand! Perhaps another 2.0 update is at hand!



https://www.rockpapershotgun.com/this-week-in-pc-games-warriors-painters-roguelikes-sailors-shotguns-subs-and-metroidvanias

item.title: Persona 3 Reload Switch 2 Edition Is Down To $40 For Black Friday
item.content:encoded:
GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

If you've picked up a Switch 2 console recently and you're looking to grab a game that'll keep you entertained for nearly 100 hours, Persona 3 Reload comes highly recommended, and it's on sale at Amazon for $40 (was $60) thanks to the retailer's Black Friday event. If you don't own a Switch 2, you can also grab the game on PS5, PS4, and Xbox Series X, but like many of the other video game deals in Amazon's event, these Persona 3 Reload discounts could run out fast, so don't wait--it could be Dark Hour on these deals before you know it.

Persona 3 Reload (Switch 2)

$40 (was $60)

Persona 3 Reload is a full-scale remake of the 2006 classic, introducing new characters, expanded storylines, an all-new voice cast, and a re-recorded soundtrack. The game also features quality-of-life improvements and a redesigned interface that refines the experience while preserving the heart of the cult-classic PS2 original.

Note that the Switch 2 version of the game comes on a Game Key-Card, which means none of the game data is included on the cart. Instead, inserting the physical game into your system unlocks the digital version, which you must download to your console before you can start playing. Expect Persona 3 Reload to take up about 25GB on your Switch 2's internal storage or SD card. It's also worth pointing out is that the Episode Aigis DLC expansion is available a separate $35 purchase on the Switch 2 eShop. Episode Aegis adds roughly 30 hours of new story content that takes place after the base game's ending, along with new costumes and music.

While Persona 3 Reload came to Switch 2 just a few months ago, it originally launched on PS5, PS4, Xbox Series X, and PC back in early 2024. The physical PlayStation and Xbox versions also happen to be on sale at Amazon, and at much lower prices than the Switch 2 version. item.title: Invincible VS Data Mine Reveals Unannounced Controversial Character
item.content:encoded:
According to a data mine from the Invincible VS Closed Alpha, a controversial character is set to join the roster. Furthermore, it seems the character may be the next one announced.

Based on the comic series and animated show, Invincible is a more bloody version of superheroes. Think The Boys, but more on the mature and dramatic side. The Prime Video show has been going strong for three seasons, with the fourth coming in March 2026. Many game adaptations have been made, but Invincible VS gives the fans what they’ve wanted: a good old-fashioned fighting game.

Announced earlier this year, the game, which comes from former Killer Instinct developers, looks to be the ultimate Invincible experience, down to the show’s all-star cast (like The Walking Dead’s Steven Yeun and Whiplash’s JK Simmons) returning. Now, it seems a new character has been prematurely revealed, and it’s one that comic book fans will be taken aback by.

Data Mine for Invincible VS Closed Alpha Reveals Anissa as Playable Fighter

The news comes from Reddit user RIPMrMufasi, who posted on /GamingLeaksandRumours about the Invincible VS Closed Alpha. The test, which started on November 21st, has been going fairly well. As was the case with Marvel Cosmic Invasion, it doesn’t stop fans from doing a data mine into the files and seeing if anything unannounced is in it. As expected, there was indeed something: a character available through a model swap bug, seen in the video here.

According to the video from the Invincible VS data mine, the character looks to be Anissa. In the show, the Viltrumite warrior is played by Shantel VanSanten (One Tree Hill, The Boys). The character, seen as an antagonist in the show, is a rather controversial choice. While not adapted into the show yet, an inappropriate moment in the comics between her and Mark, the protagonist, has made many worried about her inclusion.

As of now, the character has not been confirmed by Skybound Games or Quarter Up, so take it with a grain of salt. For fans of the show, the character is a welcome addition to the roster. However, to fans of the comics, it’s one that may stir up some controversy. Either way, if true, it won’t be long until it’s official.

What do you think of Anissa possibly being added to Invincible VS’ roster? Think it’s a controversial pick? Will it become a problem soon? Which Invincible character would you like to see in the game? Let us know in the comments and on the official Insider Gaming Discord!

For more fighting games, check out our articles on Marvel Tokon: Fighting Souls’ upcoming beta and Avatar Legends: The Fighting Game. Make sure to subscribe to our weekly newsletter!

item.title: Call of Duty, OD Actor, Udo Kier, Has Passed Away
item.content:encoded:
Udo Kier, one of the stars in Kojima Productions’ upcoming OD, has passed away. The German actor, 81, had starred in many films and shows, as well as Call of Duty: WWII.

According to Variety, the actor’s partner, Delbert McBride, confirmed the news to Variety. He passed away on Sunday morning. As of writing, there has been no comment in regards to the cause of death.

Udo Kier, A Legend On and Off Camera

Udo Kier has starred in well over 200 films, starting in 1966 on the TV show Road to Saint Tropez. His frequent collaborations with iconic artist Andy Warhol and the vampire film genre made him a familiar face for fans. In the 90s, Kier appeared in films like Ace Ventura: Pet Detective, Blade, and Johnny Mnemonic. 

He’s appeared in several video game adaptations like Far Cry and BloodRayne. However, he’s also shown up in games over the span of his career. Often military, Udo Kier played the role of Yuri in Command & Conquer: Red Alert 2 and Yuri’s Revenge. Furthermore, he played Dr. Peter Staub in Call of Duty: WWII and Erich in Martha is Dead. 

One of the actor’s future projects is OD, Hideo Kojima’s next big horror project for Kojima Productions. Unfortunately, it seems Udo Kier did not finish filming for the project, as Kojima tweeted about his passing, saying filming was set to start next Spring. The actor was announced alongside Hunter Schafer and Sophia Lillis at the 2023 Game Awards. A teaser for the Xbox Game Studios’ title was revealed earlier this year. It’s unknown if the actor will be recast or scrapped from the project at this time.

Our thoughts go out to his family and his partner during this difficult time.

What’s your favorite Udo Kier performance? Have you played a game he’s been in? Let us know in the comments and on the official Insider Gaming Discord.

For more Kojima, check out our articles on Physint and an upcoming Death Stranding anime. Make sure to subscribe to our weekly newsletter!

item.title: Meta AI-Powered Ray-Ban Sunglasses Are On Sale For Black Friday
item.content:encoded:
GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

If you've ever wished your sunglasses could play music, take photos, or even answer questions for you, then you're in luck. Select Ray-Ban Meta AI Glasses models are seeing generous discounts for Black Friday 2025. These are all Gen 1 models--so they won't have the extended battery life or upgraded cameras of the Gen 2 models--but they still offer many of the same features as the newer models, including Meta AI support, built-in speakers and camera, and more. While the smart glasses are available in a variety of frames and lens styles, it looks like only the Wayfarer frames are currently getting discounts. You can snag a pair for as low as $239.20 (normally $299) thanks to Amazon's sale.

Ray-Ban X Meta Smart Glasses - Wayfarer Frames (Gen 1)

Starts at $239

If you're unfamiliar with Meta's collaboration with Ray-Ban, these smart glasses aren't your average pair of frames. Inside its larger arms, you'll find heaps of cool tech that lets you ask Meta AI questions, take photos or videos, or listen to music. You can even ask Meta AI what you're looking at, making the smart glasses a helpful travel companion. The frames are only slightly thicker than those of some typical glasses, so unless someone is looking closely, most won't even realize you have a computer sitting on your head.

As for the actual specs, you'll find an ultra-wide 12MP camera, a five-mic system for easy voice recognition, an included charging and travel case, and a built-in button to activate its AI. Any images or footage you capture can also be easily shared on Facebook or Instagram.

While these AI-powered smart glasses are stylish, they're much simpler compared to AR and VR devices. Those who are interested in something more powerful should also check out Amazon's limited-time Black Friday deals on the Meta Quest 3S VR headset. Amazon has two deals available--the first drops the Mea Quest 3S 128GB model to just $250 (was $300) and includes a $50 Amazon gift card as a free bonus. You can also score the Meta Quest 3S bundle that includes the 256GB model of the headset with a copy of Batman: Arkham Shadow and a $49 Amazon Gift Card for just $329 (was $400). These deals are exclusive to Amazon and won't stick around long, so grab them while you can.

Meta Quest 3S VR Headset Black Friday Deals

The Quest 3S is much bigger than the Ray-Ban AI Smart Glasses, but they're also much more powerful, acting as a complete standalone, wireless VR setup (though you can also plug the headset into your PC or PS5 if you want to play more demanding VR games). If you've been curious about VR gaming but haven't jumped in yet, these bundles are an excellent way to get an affordable VR setup.

For more VR and gaming deals, head over to GameSpot's Black Friday 2025 hub.

item.title: Princess Peach's Castle 738-Piece Lego Mario Playset Is Over 50% Off At Amazon

GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

Update: This deal is no longer available.

For the second week in a row, Amazon is selling a Lego Super Mario playset for over 50% off during its Black Friday sale. Last week it was Soda Jungle Maker, and this week it's Battle with Roy at Peach's Castle. Normally $65, this 738-piece building set is discounted to only $28. Like Soda Jungle Maker, Peach's Castle is retiring soon, so this is likely your last chance to get a massive discount on the set.

Amazon has already sold out of this deal once today (November 23), but the deal is back in stock as of 5:55 PM PT.

Lego Super Mario: Battle with Roy at Peach's Castle (738 Pieces)

$28 (was $65) | Retiring soon

Battle with Roy at Peach's Castle comes with three buildable Lego Super Mario figures: Roy, Red Toad, and a Chain Chomp that pulls Roy's sled. It doesn't include Peach, who is only available as an interactive figure in the Super Mario Adventures Starter Set, which is on sale for $40 (was $50).

The castle's fold-out walls are destructible, so you can easily refortify your defenses after Chain Chomp crashes into them. If you have Interactive Princess Peach, you can tap the Action Tags on the rotating throne, in the small garden where Toad likes to hang out, and in hidden spots. Tapping an Action Tag plays music and sound effects from the Peach figure's built-in speakers.

item.title: Save $200 On The Lenovo Legion Go S For Black Friday
item.content:encoded:
GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

Mobile gaming PCs have taken off over the last couple of years, and if you've been holding out for an early Black Friday deal on one, you're in luck. The Lenovo Legion Go S has been heavily discounted, with prices ranging from $450 (was $650) for the Z2 model with a 512GB SSD and the version with the Z1 Extreme chipset, more RAM, and a 1TB SSD is available for $650 (was $900). These powerful portable gaming devices let you play the latest PC games on the go, making them an excellent gift for the hardcore PC gamer in your life. Just make sure you grab these deals soon, as these Best Buy discounts won't last long.

Legion Go S (Z2, 16GB RAM, 512GB SSD)

$450 (was $650)

The Lenovo Legion Go S comes equipped with an 8-inch 120Hz Lenovo PureSight 1200p display and an AMD Ryzen Z2 Go chip with Radeon graphics. This model includes a 512GB SSD, 16GB of RAM, and it runs on Valve's operating system, SteamOS. Storage can be expanded through the microSD slot if 512GB feels too limiting. Games typically run well from a microSD card on SteamOS, and the Z2 chip paired with Radeon graphics can handle a wide range of titles.

The handheld measures 11.75 x 1.71 x 5.02 inches, and it has a 3.5mm audio jack, two USB-C ports, offset thumbsticks, two remappable back triggers, and a small trackpad.

Legion Go S (Z1 Extreme, 32GB RAM, 1TB SSD)

$650 (was $900)

The higher-end configuration of the Lenovo Legion Go S uses the older but still powerful AMD Ryzen Z1 Extreme chip with AMD RDNA 3 graphics. It has 32GB of RAM and a larger 1TB SSD, and like the model above, it runs on SteamOS. It features the same screen, inputs, and ergonomic design that has earned praise from critics.

Other handheld gaming PCs, such as the recently released ROG Xbox Ally X, are still selling at their regular MSRP, but Best Buy is offering discounts on the MSI Claw. You can save $180 to $265 on two models: the MSI Claw A1M with a 512GB SSD is down to $390, down from $650, while the 1TB version is $565 (was $750). These units feature 7-inch 1080p screens with a 120Hz refresh rate; 16GB of RAM, Intel Arc Graphics 8X cores, and Intel Core Ultra processors.

Both MSI Claw models run Windows 11, which means you can load games from multiple storefronts, including Steam, GOG, and the Epic Games Store. The trade-off is that Windows can be cumbersome on a handheld PC, but if that does not bother you, you will have far more flexibility when installing and managing games.

MSI Claw A1M Black Friday Deals

  • MSI Claw A1M (512GB SSD, 16GB RAM, Intel Core Ultra 5-135H) -- $390 ($650)
  • MSI Claw A1M (512GB SSD, 16GB RAM, Intel Core Ultra 7-155H) -- $565 ($750)

item.title: HP Went Full Liquidation on 17″ Laptop (i5, 32GB RAM, 1TB SSD), 71% Off Turns $3K Into Pocket Change
item.content:encoded:
Apple manages impressive 25% discounts on MacBooks through Amazon during Black Friday, but this HP laptop just shattered discount records with a massive 71% price drop.

Amazon dropped this HP laptop to an all-time low of $859 for Black Friday, down from its usual $2,999 price tag. For this price, you get a 13th Gen Intel 10-core i5 processor, 17.3-inch Full HD display, 32GB of RAM, and 1TB SSD storage. Windows 11 Pro comes preloaded with Copilot AI, and HP includes a backlit keyboard plus fingerprint reader for security.

See at Amazon

10-Core Intel Power That Handles Real Work

The 13th Generation Intel Core i5-1334U processor has 10 cores that turbo boost up to 4.6GHz if you need that extra horsepower. The hybrid architecture splits the cores between performance and efficiency, throwing the heavy lifting of demanding tasks to powerful cores while background processes run on efficient cores. You can open multiple Chrome tabs, Microsoft Office applications, video conferencing software, and photo editing programs all at once without any lag.

The 32GB DDR4 RAM removes memory bottlenecks that plague laptops with 8GB or 16GB configurations. You keep dozens of browser tabs open, switch between heavy applications, and work with large datasets without seeing the dreaded spinning wheel. Virtual machines run smoothly for developers or IT professionals who need to test software across different environments.

The 1TB PCIe NVMe SSD provides read speeds to make the entire system snappy and responsive. It boots up Windows in seconds, launches applications almost instantly, and complete file transfers in no time. The storage capacity holds an entire work library of documents, presentations, spreadsheets, photos, videos, and software installations without the constant management of the drive.

The 17.3-inch Full HD display provides serious screen real estate at 1920×1080 resolution. You can view full spreadsheets without horizontal scrolling, edit documents with toolbars visible, and run applications side-by-side comfortably. The anti-glare coating reduces eye strain during marathon work sessions and makes the screen readable in bright offices or near windows.

Fingerprint reader security provides instant login without the need to type passwords every time one opens the laptop. Biometric authentication works quicker and more reliably than passwords, while it offers better security compared with simple PINs. You unlock the laptop with a quick touch of your finger, jumping right into work without delays in authentication. The fingerprint data remains stored locally on the device rather than in cloud databases.

Wi-Fi 6 gives you faster wireless speeds and greater performance in crowded networks than ever before. Fast transfer of bulky files, smooth video streaming, and jitter-free video conferencing are now possible. Bluetooth 5.3 connects your wireless mouse, keyboard, headphones, and other accessories with greater range and reliability. USB Type-A and Type-C ports support existing peripherals and accessories along with newer ones without the need for dongles.

Windows 11 Pro incorporates enterprise features, remote desktop access, and domain joining for business users. Integration with Copilot AI will help users brainstorm ideas, organize tasks, create drafts of content, and answer questions directly in Windows. The AI assistant simplifies your workflow by automating routine tasks for you and displaying relevant suggested actions based on how you work.

This 17.3-inch laptop delivers 10-core Intel performance with 32GB RAM and 1TB SSD for nearly $2,000 off its usual price, at just $859.

See at Amazon

item.title: Sonic X Shadow Generations for Switch 2 is 50% off (BF2025)
item.content:encoded:
GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

Sonic X Shadow Generations launched just over a year ago on Switch, PS5, Xbox Series X|S, and PC, and recently got an official port to Switch 2 just a few months ago. The game features a remaster of 2011's Sonic Generations alongside the all-new Shadow Generations, offering fans two completely unique games in one package. And now, for Black Friday 2025, the game is discounted to its lowest price ever of just $25 (was $50) on Nintendo Switch 2, Nintendo Switch, PS5, and Xbox Series X. You'll also find a bunch of other Sonic games on sale during the event, making this a good time to stock up on titles you may have missed over the past few years.

Sonic X Shadow Generations

$25 (was $50)

Sonic X Shadow Generations offers both 3D and 2D adventures, playing as a greatest-hits roundup for the Blue Blur. For a change of pace, however, you can dive into Shadow Generations, which lets you take control of Shadow as he fights through a brand new adventure. There are plenty of Easter eggs and additional content packed into the bundle--so even once you beat the game, there's always a reason to come back for more. This includes hidden Chao across each level, a chance to play pinball in the Casino Nights zone, and a museum featuring all sorts of behind-the-scenes material.

Sonic X Shadow Generations Deals At Amazon

  • PS5 -- $25 ($50)
  • Xbox -- $25 ($50)
  • Switch -- $25 ($50)
  • Switch 2 -- $25 ($50)

Our Sonic X Shadow Generations review called it a "nice enough trip down memory lane," though it does come with some friction due to the age of Sonic Generations. If you're a Sonic fan, you'll probably find something here of value (especially at $25). "Shadow Generations' story is a great opportunity to revisit some of Shadow's most memorable moments as well as past boss battles against other artificial beings that could be considered rivals to the title of "ultimate life form," like the Biolizard from Sonic Adventure 2," wrote critic Jordan Ramée. "I was grinning like a kid again when Shadow faced off against Metal Overlord and Crush 40's "What I'm Made Of..." started playing, reminding me of the hours I lost to Sonic Heroes when I was 10 years old."

Many other Sonic games are on sale for Black Friday, including Sonic Frontiers, which is down to $18 on PS5, $16 on PS4, $10 on Xbox Series X, and $25 on Switch. You can also pick up the Sonic Mania + Team Sonic Racing Double Pack for just $20 (was $40). You'll find a list of even more Sonic game deals below. While these are big discounts on some of the Blue Hedgehog's latest games, keep in mind these deals will likely vanish after Black Friday, so be sure to take advantage of them while they're still active. item.title: Save Up To 70% On Atlus RPGs - Metaphor ReFantazio, Persona, SMT & more
item.content:encoded:
GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

If you're craving a big RPG for the winter months, you're in luck. Several of Atlus and Sega's best RPGs are up to 70% off at Amazon thanks to Black Friday. The deals include Metaphor ReFantazio--the recipient of GameSpot's 2024 Game of the Year pick--which is on sale for for $35 (was $70) for both PS5 and Xbox Series X. While Metaphor ReFantazio's sweeping fantasy story could easily keep you busy for 80 to 100 hours, there are also plenty of other epic RPGs on sale right now, including Persona 3: Reload, Shin Megami Tensei V: Vengeance Edition, Raidou Remastered, and more. We've rounded up all the Atlus RPG Black Friday deals below--be sure to grab them while you can, because these limited-time discounts could sell out fast. After you've checked those out, head over to GameSpot's Black Friday Deals Hub to see all the best holiday price cuts on video games, PC hardware, collectible figures, and more.

Metaphor ReFantazio

$35 (was $70)

Metaphor ReFantazio shares several elements with other JRPGS from Atlus, but it also streamlines the experience and keeps players invested with enticing gameplay and a roster of lovable characters. While it's an engaging game to play, Metaphor ReFantazio shines brightest when its narrative steps into the spotlight, as the game features a story honed to a razor's edge by Atlus subsidiary Studio Zero. It's a story about stories, cleverly woven into the fabric of the game and bolstered by rich lore, in-depth worldbuilding, and an art direction that makes the fantasy of Metaphor ReFantazio look unique.

The game received a rare 10/10 in GameSpot's review and it was also named our 2024 Game of the Year.

Metaphor ReFantazio deals at Amazon

  • PS5 -- $35 ($70)
  • Xbox Series X -- $35 ($70)

Persona 3: Reload

Starts at $18

A remake of 2006's Persona 3, Persona 3 Reload keeps the game's core story intact and elevates it with brand-new gameplay and visuals. Still faithful to the original, Persona 3 Reload makes an already great game even better with its enhancements. Amazon's pricing differs between consoles--PS5 owners can get the game for just $18, while the PS4 version is $20, the Xbox Series X version is $25, and the Switch 2 version is $40 (was $60). Note that the Switch 2 version is a game key-card release, meaning you have to download the digital version to your console (around 25.3GB file size) before you can play.

Persona 3: Reload deals at Amazon

  • PS5 -- $18 ($70)
  • PS4 -- $20 ($70)
  • Xbox Series X -- $25 ($70)
  • Switch 2 (Game Key-Card) -- $40 ($60)

Persona 5 Royal (Switch)

$25 (was $60)

Atlus had earned a loyal following over the years with its Persona games, but Persona 5 is arguably the game that put the company on radar of JRPG fans looking for something different. The anime art style, rich character relationships, and an overarching story that will take dozens of hours to complete made it a big hit, and the Royal Edition of the game fleshes out those aspects of the game even further with quality-of-life tweaks and more content.

Raidou Remastered: The Mystery of the Soulless Army

$30 (was $50)

Another blast from the past, Raidou Remastered is a remake of a 2006 PS2 game from the Shin Megami Tensei series. Part of the Devil Summoner subseries, the action-RPG features revamped visuals and audio, combat enhancements, brand voice acting, expanded 3D environments, and a slick user interface. Set in 1930s Tokyo, players embark on a supernatural adventure, collecting dozens of demons to aid them in their quest to prevent humanity from being consumed by darkness.

As with other Atlus games released on Switch 2, Raidou Remastered's physical Switch 2 edition is a game key-card that grants access to the digital version of the game, rather than storing the game data on the cart. The game requires just under 12GB.

Raidou Remastered deals at Amazon

  • PS5 -- $30 ($50)
  • Xbox Series X -- $40 ($50)
  • Switch -- $30 ($50)
  • Switch 2 (Game Key-Card) -- $30 ($50)

Shin Megami Tensei V: Vengeance

$18 (was $60)

Originally exclusive to Nintendo Switch, Shin Megami Tensei eventually came to other consoles as part of an upgraded release, dubbed the Vengeance. This version of Shin Megami Tensei V addressed many of the original game's shortcomings, fine-tuning the combat and exploration while adding updated visuals and new story content. Set in a version of Tokyo destroyed by a demonic invasion, players harness this dark power on their journey as they amass an army of loyal demons.

Note that Amazon's discount only appears to apply to the PS5 and Nintendo Switch versions of the game, both of which are cut to just $18 (normally $60). That's a massive 70% discount. The Xbox Series X edition is also available, but is currently priced at $45.

item.title: Roborock Qrevo CurvX Drops to All-Time Low, 22,000Pa Beast With Auto Hot Water Cleaning Falls to Record Pricing
item.content:encoded:
Roborock holds the same premium position in robot vacuums that Dyson commands in traditional vacuums, with flagship models regularly exceeding $1,500 to $2,000. These luxury cleaning machines pack technology that separates them from budget competitors flooding the market.

The good news is that Amazon just dropped one of Roborock’s best-sellers to an all-time low of $849 for Black Friday, nearly half off from its usual $1,499 price tag. The Qrevo CurvX delivers 22,000Pa suction, zero-tangling design, reactive AI obstacle recognition and 80°C hot water mop washing.

See at Amazon

Technology That Solves Real Cleaning Problems

The 22,000Pa HyperForce suction creates enough force to pull deeply embedded dirt from carpet pile and pulls debris from gaps in hardwood flooring. You can immediately tell the difference compared with a vacuum that has only 8,000-10,000Pa-suction power and tends to push dust instead of picking it up. Pet hair, long human hair up to 40cm, cereal crumbs, and tracked-in dirt-all get pulled into the dustbin in one pass. The zero-tangling design stops hair from tangling around the brushes, thus doing away with the maintenance nightmare of standard robot vacuums where you end up spending 15 minutes each week cutting tangled hair off rollers.

The ultra-slim profile, at only 3.14 inches, makes this the thinnest Roborock ever manufactured-just 7.98cm tall. This reduced height lets the robot glide under sofas, beds, and cabinets where dust bunnies really collect. Traditional robot vacuums with raised LiDAR domes get stuck or completely skip whole sections below furniture. This Roborock reaches those forgotten spaces and captures hidden dirt that ruins air quality even when visible floors appear clean.

Reactive AI obstacle recognition relies on structured light and an RGB camera to detect and avoid 108 different object types. It works both in bright and dark environments and navigates around toys, cables, pet bowls, shoes, and even furniture legs without getting stuck. You don’t have to preclean your floors before running the vacuum, which really changes the vacuum from a scheduled maintenance tool into something you can turn on spontaneously.

AdaptiLift Chassis is industry-first technology that can lift the entire robot up to 4cm or individually according to terrain. The system raises the front to climb high thresholds, adjusts side wheels to navigate around furniture legs, and lowers for tight clearances. This adaptability prevents the ‘stuck’ notifications which interrupt other robot vacuums in mid-clean.

The 80°C hot water washing of the mop dissolves stubborn stains and grease left by cold water. The dock heats water to 176°F before washing the mop pads to make sure they are thoroughly cleaned and sanitized after each use. Warm air drying at 113°F prevents mildew and odors from forming on damp mop pads. This focus on hygiene means your robot will never spread dirty water around on your floors in the course of subsequent cleaning.

The automated maintenance tasks handled by the Multifunctional Dock 3.0 Thermo+ mean you barely touch the robot. Auto dust emptying transfers collected debris to the dock’s larger bag, holding weeks of dirt. Auto tank refilling keeps the water reservoir full for mopping sessions. Intelligent dirt detection analyzes mop pad contamination and adjusts washing intensity accordingly. The dock performs self-cleaning with hot water, preventing the buildup that makes other docking stations smell terrible after a few weeks.

At $849, this Roborock delivers flagship cleaning technology and hot water mop washing for $650 off the usual price. You are getting premium features that normally would call for an outlay in excess of $1,500+, skimping on very few minor conveniences.

See at Amazon

item.title: Mario & Sonic At The Olympic Games 2020 Is 50% Off
item.content:encoded:
GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

The 2026 Winter Olympics take place next February in Milano and Cortina, Italy, but you can get a head start with your own virtual Olympics thanks to a Black Friday deal dropping Mario & Sonic at the Olympic Games Tokyo 2020 for Nintendo Switch down to $30 (was $60). That's just barely above its all-time low price of $29.53. While Mario & Sonic at the Olympic Games Tokyo 2020 is focused on Summer Olympic sports, Amazon's 50% discount is a great way to get in the Olympic spirit a few months before the winter event kicks off.

Mario & Sonic at the Olympic Games Tokyo 2020

$30 (was $60)

Mario & Sonic at the Olympic Games Tokyo 2020 features 34 events, a variety of minigames, and both single-player and multiplayer modes. You'll find all the Summer Olympic staples here, taking you from the track to the swimming pool and boxing ring to the archery range. Each event ranges in complexity--most feature easy-to-learn controls, while others, like soccer and rugby, offer more depth and challenge, making this a great minigame collection for players of all skill levels. The roster of playable characters includes familiar faces from both the Sonic and Mario series, including the titular mascots themselves, and friends like Luigi, Tails, Waluigi, Dr. Eggman, and more.

Our Mario & Sonic at the Olympic Games Tokyo 2020 review gave it a 7/10, due to its entertaining events (each with its own gimmick) and unique control schemes that make it easy to find a playstyle that works for just about everyone.

"Mario & Sonic at the Tokyo Olympic Games 2020 is an entertaining take on the sports-event genre that has, by and large, disappeared in the modern-day," wrote critic James O'Connor. "The game aims for accessibility at every opportunity, and while nothing about it is particularly exceptional, it still has plenty of unique flourishes to offer, and the wealth of different events and simple controls make for an appealing casual multiplayer title. Thanks to a generous selection of events and a few neat gimmicks, Mario & Sonic at the Olympic Games Tokyo 2020 is the best entry in this series."

Amazon is discounting several other Switch exclusives for Black Friday 2025, including hits like Super Mario Odyssey, but the deals are selling out quickly. We've listed the remaining Nintendo Switch discounts available at Amazon below. We also have a Black Friday Deals Hub where you'll find even more deals on games for other platforms like PlayStation 5 and Xbox Series X, as well as the latest price cuts on Blu-rays, Lego sets, anime, and more.
